criteria.name: Relevance
criteria.description: The solution directly addresses the identified problems and client requirements.

criteria.name: Feasibility
criteria.description: The solution is technically, operationally, and financially viable within the constraints provided.

criteria.name: Comprehensiveness
criteria.description: The solution addresses all major aspects of the problem space without significant gaps.

criteria.name: Specificity
criteria.description: The solution is detailed with concrete steps, components, or features rather than vague concepts.

criteria.name: Effectiveness
criteria.description: The solution is likely to achieve the desired outcomes and objectives when implemented.

criteria.name: Innovation
criteria.description: The solution demonstrates creative thinking and offers advantages over standard approaches.

criteria.name: Scalability
criteria.description: The solution can be scaled up or down to meet changing needs without redesign.

criteria.name: Research Alignment
criteria.description: The solution incorporates and is informed by the research findings.

criteria.name: Clarity
criteria.description: The solution is presented clearly with well-defined components and implementation path.

criteria.name: User Focus
criteria.description: The solution prioritizes user needs and experience considerations.

criteria.name: Risk Mitigation
criteria.description: The solution identifies potential risks and includes strategies to address them.

criteria.name: Sustainability
criteria.description: The solution can be maintained and supported over time with reasonable resources.

evaluationInstructions: Evaluate the proposed solution against each criterion. For each criterion, provide a score between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely failing to meet the criterion and 1.0 is perfectly meeting it. Provide specific feedback for scores below the pass threshold.
